newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real rises 0.05 pct on dollar inflows.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real rises 0.05 pct on dollar inflows.

text.p: Brazil's real rose 0.05 percent to close at 1.0166 reais against the dollar in the commercial foreign exchange market due to dollar inflows, dealers said.
In early morning, the real traded at about 1.0170 per dollar, following Tuesday's $31.6 million deficit for commercial and financial forex contracts, dealers said.
Moreover, some banks also bought dollars, speculating on a possible drop in the real-dollar mini-band today, from the current 1.016-1.021 to the dollar, they added.
But the real began rising in late morning after the daily dollar flows started to show a superavit.
Preliminary figures for Wednesday showed a $100 million surplus in forex contracts in late afternoon.
In the interbank foreign exchange floating rate market, the real dropped 0.02 percent to close at 1.0212 to the dollar.
In the illegal parallel market, the real ended flat at 1.027 per greenback, traders said.
